characters: INT. THE STUDY, WITH KATIE NIGHT
THE PHONE NOOK, WITH KATIE AND BILL, REPRISE
THE PHONE NOOK, WITH DENNIS AND THE OTHERS
THE CAR, WITH BILL AND KATIE
EXT. A LOW SLUNG SPORTS CAR PASSES THE CAMERA NIGHT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Drac's standing at the door of his Transylvanian castle. has pasted a comic-balloon coming out of his mouth which "Listen! My children of the night! What music they make!" poster is on a door but we only see this as JEFF opens it into his father's study.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA HOLDS, THEN PANS SLOWLY RIGHT. We pass another this one of POLLY, the daughter away at school. She's a l girl of sixteen or so. Past POLLY is DENNIS... then CONNI JEFF. THE CAMERA CONTINUES TO PAN AND ALSO WIDENS OUT so we can WEIDERMAN, a man of about forty-four. He looks tired. He' into the word-processor on his desk, but his mental cryst must be taking the night off, because the screen is blank walls we see framed book-covers. All of them are spooky. the titles is "Ghost Kiss." JEFF comes up quietly behind his dad. The carpet muffles BILL sighs and shuts off the word-cruncher. A moment late claps his hands on his father's shoulders.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi, Jeffie. He turns in his chair to look at his son, who is disappoi

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: How come you didn't get scared?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Scaring is my business. I'm case-hardened. Something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Daddy, can I watch the first hour of "Ghost Kiss" and you tape the rest? Dennis and Connie are hogging everything. BILL swivels to look at the book-jacket, bemused.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: You sure you want to watch that, champ? It's pretty-

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: Yes!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In this shot, we clearly see the stairs leading to her hu study behind her.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I really think Jeff needs the orthodontic work but you know Bill- The other line rings. The other light stutters

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: That's just the other line. Bill will- But now we see BILL and JEFF coming downstairs behind her

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Honey, where're the blank videotapes? I can't find any in the study and- KATIE (to BILL) Wait! (to LOIS) Gonna put you on hold a sec, Lo. She does. Now both lines are blinking. She pushes the top where the new call has just come in.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Hello, Weiderman residence. SOUND: DESPERATE SOBBING. SOBBING VOICE (filter)  Take... please take... t-t-

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Polly? Is that you? What's wrong? SOUND: SOBBING. It's awful, heartbreaking. SOBBING VOICE (filter) Please-quick- SOUND: SOBBING... Then, CLICK! A broken connection.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Polly, calm down! Whatever it is can't be that b- HUM OF AN OPEN LINE. JEFF has wandered toward the TV room, hoping to find a bl

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Who was that? Without looking at her husband or answering him, KATIE sl lower button in again.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Lois? Listen, I'll call you back. That was Polly, and she sounded very upset. No... she hung up. Yes. I will. Thanks. She hangs up. BILL (concerned) It was Polly?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Crying her head off. It sounded like she was trying to say "Please take me home"... I knew that damn school was bumming her out... Why I ever let you talk me into it... She's rummaging frantically on her little phone desk. Cat go slithering to the floor around her stool.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Connie did you take my address book? CONNIE (voice) No, Mom. BILL pulls a battered book out of his back pocket and pag through it.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I got it. Except-

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I know, damn dorm phone is always busy.  Give it to me.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Honey, calm down.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I'll calm down after I talk to her. She is sixteen, Bill. Sixteen-year-old girls are prone to depressive interludes. Sometimes they even k... just give me the damn number!
As she punches the numbers, THE CAMERA SLIDES IN TO CU.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Come on, come on... don't be busy... just this once... SOUND: CLICKS. A pause. Then... the phone starts ringing. KATIE (eyes closed) Thank You, God. VOICE (filter) Hartshorn Hall, this is Frieda. If you want Christine the Sex Queen, she's still in the shower, Arnie.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Could you call Polly to the phone? Polly Weiderman? This is Katie Weiderman. Her mother. VOICE (filter) Oh, Jeez! Sorry. I thought- hang on, please, Mrs. Weiderman. SOUND: THE PHONE CLUNKS DOWN. VOICE (filter, and very faint) Polly? Pol?... Phone call!... It's your mother!

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Well?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Somebody's getting her, I hope. JEFF comes back in with a tape.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I found one, Dad. Dennis hid em. As usual.  JEFF goes.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: In a minute, Jeff. Go watch the tube.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: But-

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I won't forget. Now go on.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Come on, come on, come on...

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Calm down, Katie. KATIE (snaps) If you'd heard her, you wouldn't tell me to calm down! She sounded- POLLY (filter, cheery voice) Hi, mom!

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Pol? Honey? Are you all right? POLLY (happy, bubbling voice) Am I all right? I aced my bio exam, got a B on my French Conversational Essay, and Ronnie Hansen asked me to the Harvest Ball. I'm so all right that if one more good thing happens to me today, I'll probably blow up like the Hindenburg.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: You didn't just call me up, crying your head off? We see by KATIE's face that she already knows the answer question. POLLY (filter) Heck no!

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I'm glad about your test and your date, honey. I guess it was someone else. I'll call you back, okay? POLLY (filter) "Kay. Say hi to Dad!

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I will.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: She okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. I could have sworn it was Polly, but... she's walking on air.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: So it was a prank. Or someone who was crying so hard she dialed a wrong number â€œthrough a shimmering film of tears," as we veteran hacks like to say.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: It was not a prank and it was not a wrong number! It was someone in my family!

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Honey, you can't know that.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: No? If Jeffie called up, just crying, would you know it was him? BILL (struck by this) Yeah, maybe. I guess I might. She's not listening. She's punching numbers. She doesn't

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Who you calling? answer him. SOUND: PHONE RINGS TWICE. Then: OLDER FEMALE VOICE (filter Hello?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Mom? Are you... (She pauses) Did you call just a few seconds ago? VOICE (filter) No, dear... why?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Oh... you know these phones. I was talking to Lois and I lost the other call. VOICE (filter) Well, it wasn't me. Kate, I saw the prettiest dress in La Boutique today, and-

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: We'll talk about it later, Mom, okay? VOICE (filter) Kate, are you all right?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I have... Mom, I think maybe I've got diarrhea. I have to go. 'Bye. She hangs up. BILL hangs on until she does, then he burs wild donkey-brays of LAUGHTER.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Oh boy... diarrhea... I gotta remember that the next time my agent calls... oh Katie, that was so cool- KATIE (almost screaming) This is not funny! BILL stops laughing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JEFF and DENNIS have been tussling. They stop. All three toward the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I tell you it was someone in my family and she sounded- oh, you donâ€™t understand. I knew that voice.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: But if Polly's okay and your mom's okay... KATIE (positive) It's Dawn.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Come on, hon, a minute ago you were sure it was Polly.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: It had to be Dawn. I was on the phone with Lois and Mom's okay so Dawn's the only other one it could have been. She's the youngest...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have mistaken her for Polly... and she's out there in that farmhouse alone with the baby! BILL (startled) What do you mean, alone?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Jerry's in Burlington! It's Dawn! Something's happened to Dawn! CONNIE comes into the kitchen, worried.

dialogues.speaker: CONNIE
dialogues.text: Mom? Is Aunt Dawn okay?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: So far as we know, she's fine. Take it easy, doll. Bad to buy trouble  before you know it's on sale. KATIE punches numbers and listens. SOUND: The DAH-DAH-DAH busy signal. KATIE hangs up. BILL looks a question at her raised eyebrows.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Busy.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Katie, are you sure-

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: She's the only one left- it had to be her. Bill, I'm scared. Will you drive me out there? BILL takes the phone from her.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: What's her number?
BILL dials. Gets a busy. Hangs up and punches 0. OPERATOR (filter) Operator.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I'm trying to reach my sister-in-law, operator. The line is busy. I suspect there may be a problem. Can you break into the call, please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All three kids standing there, silent and worried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: OPERATOR (filter) What is your name, sir?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: William Weiderman. My number is- OPERATOR (filter) Not the William Weiderman that wrote "Spider Doom?!"

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yes, that was mine. If- OPERATOR (filter) Oh my God, I just loved that book! I love all your books! I-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm delighted you do. But right now my wife is very worried about her sister. If it's possible for you to- OPERATOR (filter) Yes, I can do that. Please give me your number, Mr. Weiderman, for the records. (She GIGGLES) I promise not to give it out.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: It's 555-4408. OPERATOR (filter) And the call number? BILL (looks at KATIE) Uh...
OPERATOR (filter) Just a moment, Mr. Weiderman... "Night of the Beast" was also great, by the way. Hold on. SOUND: TELEPHONIC CLICKS AND CLACKS.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Is she-

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yes. Just... There's one final CLICK. OPERATOR (filter) I'm sorry, Mr. Weiderman, but that line is not busy. It's off the hook. I wonder if I sent you my copy of "Spider Doom-" BILL hangs up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Why did you hang up?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: She can't break in. Phone's not busy. It's off the hook. They stare at each other blankly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATIE's scared. BILL, at the wheel, doesn't look exactly

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Hey, Bill-tell me she's all right.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: She's all right.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Now tell me what you really think.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Jeff snuck up behind me tonight and put the old booga-booga on me. He was disappointed as hell when I didn't jump. I told him I was case-hardened. (Pause) I lied.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Why did Jerry have to move out there when he's gone half the time? Just her and that little tiny baby? Why?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Shhh, Kate. We're almost there.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Go faster.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He does. That car is smoking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The tube's still on and the kids are still there, but the around has stopped.

dialogues.speaker: CONNIE
dialogues.text: Dennis, do you think Aunt Dawn's okay? DENNIS (thinks she's dead, decapitated by a maniac) Yeah. Sure she is.

dialogues.speaker: THE TV ROOM
dialogues.text: Just sitting there on the wall in the phone nook, lights looking like a snake ready to strike. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A long driveway leads up to it. There's one light on in t room. Car lights sweep up the driveway. The WEIDERMAN car close to the garage and stops.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I'm scared. BILL bends down, reaches under his seat, and brings out a BILL (solemnly) Booga-booga. KATIE (total surprise) How long have you had that?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Since last year. I didn't want to scare you or the kids. I've got a license to carry. Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They get out. KATIE stands by the front of the car while to the garage and peers in.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Her car's here. THE CAMERA TRACKS WITH THEM to the front door. Now we can TV, PLAYING LOUD. BILL pushes the doorbell. We hear it in They wait. KATIE pushes it. Still no answer. She pushes i and doesn't take her finger off. BILL looks down at:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big scratches on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BILL (low) The lock's been tampered with. KATIE looks, and whimpers. BILL tries the door. It opens. is louder.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Stay behind me. Be ready to run if something happens. God, I wish I'd left you home, Kate. He starts in. KATIE comes after him, terrified, near tear

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From this angle we see only a small section of the room. much louder. BILL enters the room, gun up. He looks to th right... and suddenly all the tension goes out of him. He the gun. KATIE (draws up beside him) Bill... what... He points.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place looks like a cyclone hit it... but it wasn't ro murder that caused this mess; only a healthy eighteen-mon baby. After a strenuous day of trashing the living room, tired and Mommy got tired and they fell asleep on the cou together. The baby is in DAWN's lap. There is a pair of W earphones on her head. There are toys- tough plastic Sesa and PlaySkool stuff, for the most part- scattered hell to breakfast. The baby has also pulled most of the books out bookcase. Had a good munch on one of them, too, by the lo goes over and picks it up. It is "Ghost Kiss."

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I've had people say they just eat my books up, but this is ridiculous. He's amused. KATIE isn't. She walks over to her sister, r be mad... but she sees how really exhausted DAWN looks an softens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fast asleep and breathing easily, like a Raphael painting Madonna and Child. THE CAMERA PANS DOWN TO: the Walkman. hear the faint strains of Huey Lewis and the News. THE CA A BIT FURTHER TO a Princess telephone on the table by the It's off the cradle. Not much; just enough to break the c and scare people to death.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She sighs, bends down, and replaces the phone. Then she p STOP button on the Walkman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DAWN wakes up when the music stops. Looks at BILL and KAT puzzled. DAWN (fuzzed out) Well... hi. She realizes she's got the Walkman phones on and removes  She smiles.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Hi, Dawn. DAWN (still half asleep) Shoulda called, guys. Place is a mess. She's radiant when she smiles.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: We tried. The operator told Bill the phone was off the hook. I thought something was wrong. How can you sleep with that music blasting?

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: It's restful. (sees the gnawed book BILL's holding) Oh my God, Bill, I'm sorry! Justin's teething and-

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: There are critics who'd say he picked just the right thing to teethe on. I don't want to scare you, beautiful, but somebody's been at your front door lock with a screwdriver or something. Whoever it was forced it.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Gosh, no! That was Jerry, last week. I locked us out by mistake and he didn't have his key and the spare wasn't over the door like it's supposed to be. He was mad because he had to take a whiz real bad and so he took the screwdriver to it. It didn't work, either- that's one tough lock. (Pause) By the time I found my key he'd already gone in the bushes.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: If it wasn't forced, how come I could just open the door and walk in? DAWN (guiltily) Well... sometimes I forget to lock it.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: You didn't call me tonight, Dawn?

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Gee, no! I didn't call anyone! I was too busy chasing Justin around! He kept wanting to eat the fabric softener! Then he got sleepy and I sat down here and thought I'd listen to some tunes while I waited for your movie to come on, Bill, and I fell asleep- At the mention of the movie BILL starts visibly and look book. Then he glances at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I promised to tape it for Jeff. Come on, Katie, we've got time to get back.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Just a second. She picks up the phone and dials. INT. INT.

dialogues.speaker: DAWN
dialogues.text: Gee, Bill, do you think Jeffie's old enough to watch something like that?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: It's network. They take out the blood-bags. DAWN (confused but amiable) Oh. That's good.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE, CU
dialogues.text: DENNIS (filter) Hello?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Just thought you'd like to know your Aunt Dawn's fine. DENNIS (filter) Oh! Cool. Thanks, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: THE PHONE NOOK, WITH DENNIS AND THE OTHERS
dialogues.text: He looks very relieved. INT. DENNIS. Aunt Dawn's okay.

dialogues.speaker: THE CAR, WITH BILL AND KATIE
dialogues.text: They drive in silence for awhile.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: You think I'm a hysterical idiot, don't you? BILL (genuinely surprised) No! I was scared, too.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: You sure you're not mad?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I'm too relieved. (Laughs) She's sort  of a scatterbrain, old Dawn, but I love her. KATIE (leans over and kisses him) I love you. You're a sweet man.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I'm the boogeyman!

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I am not fooled, sweetheart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PASSES THE CAMERA and we DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His room is dark. The covers are pulled up to his chin.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: You promise to tape the rest? CAMERA WIDENS OUT so we can see BILL, sitting on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: I promise.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I especially liked the part where the dead guy ripped off the punk rocker's head.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Well... they used to take out all the blood-bags.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: What, Dad?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Nothing. I love you, Jeffie.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: I love you, too. So does Rambo. JEFF holds up a stuffed dragon of decidedly unmilitant as BILL kisses the dragon, then JEFF.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: "Night.

dialogues.speaker: JEFF
dialogues.text: "Night. (As BILL reaches his door Glad Aunt Dawn was okay.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Me, too.  He goes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy who looks like he died in a car crash about two wee to filming (and has since been subjected to a lot of hot is staggering out of a crypt. THE CAMERA WIDENS to show B releasing the VCR PAUSE button. KATIE (voice) Booga-booga. BILL looks around companionably. THE CAMERA WIDENS OUT MO show KATIE, wearing a sexy nightgown.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Same to you. I missed the first forty seconds or so after the break. I had to kiss Rambo.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: You sure you're not mad at me, Bill? He goes to her and kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Not even a smidge.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: It's just that I could have sworn it was one of mine. You know what I mean? One of mine?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I can still hear those sobs. So lost... so heartbroken.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Kate, have you ever thought you recognized someone on the street, and called her, and when she finally turned around it was a total stranger?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Yes, once. In Seattle. I was in a mall and I thought I saw my old roommate. I... oh. I see what you're saying.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Sure. There are sound-alikes as well as look-alikes.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: But... you know your own. At least I thought so until tonight. She puts her cheek on his shoulder, looking troubled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was so positive it was Polly...

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Because you've been worried about her getting her feet under her at the new school... but judging from the stuff she told you tonight, I'd say she's doing just fine in that department. Wouldn't you?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Yes... I guess I would.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Let it go, hon. KATIE (looks at him closely) I hate to see you looking so tired. Hurry up and have an idea, you.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Well, I'm trying.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: You coming to bed?

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Soon as I finish taping this for Jeff. KATIE (amused) Bill, that machine was made by Japanese technicians who think of damned near everything. It'll run on its own.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: Yeah, but it's been a long time since I've seen this one, and...

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Okay. Enjoy. I think I'll be awake for a little while. (Pause) I've got a few ideas of my own. BILL (smiles) Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Yeah. She starts out, showing a lot of leg, then turns in the d something else strikes her.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: If they show that part where the punk's head gets- BILL (guiltily) I'll edit it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: â€˜Night. And thanks again. For everything. She leaves. BILL sits in his chair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A couple is necking in a car. Suddenly the passenger door ripped open by the dead guy and we DISSOLVE TO:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's dark. She's asleep. She wakes up... sort of. KATIE (sleepy) Hey, big guy- She feels for him, but his side of the bed is empty, the still pulled up. She sits up. Looks at:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It says 2:03 A.M. Then it flashes to 2:04.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fully awake now. And concerned. She gets up, puts on her leaves the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Snow. KATIE (voice, approaching) Bill? Honey? You okay? Bill? Bi-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's frozen, wide-eyed with horror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's slumped to one side, eyes closed, hand inside his sh was sleeping. BILL is not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MINISTER (voice) And so we commit the earthly remains of William Weiderman to the ground, confident of his spirit and soul. "Be ye not cast down, brethren..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the WEIDERMANS are ranged here. KATIE and POLLY wear black dresses and veils. CONNIE wears a black skirt and w blouse. DENNIS and JEFF wear black suits. JEFF is crying. Rambo the Dragon under his arm for a little extra comfort CAMERA MOVES IN ON KATIE. Tears course slowly down her ch bends and gets a handful of earth. Tosses it into the gra

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Love you, big guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Weeping.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scattered earth on top of the coffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GROUNDSKEEPER pats the last sod into place.

dialogues.speaker: GROUNDSKEEPER
dialogues.text: My wife says she wishes you'd written a couple more before you had your heart attack, mister. (Pause) I like Westerns, m'self. THE GROUNDSKEEPER walks away, whistling.

dialogues.speaker: TITLE CARD
dialogues.text: THE WEDDING MARCH is playing. POLLY, older and radiant wi emerges into a pelting shower of rice. She's in a wedding her new husband by her side. Celebrants throwing rice line either side of the path. Fr the bride and groom come others. Among them are KATIE, DE CONNIE, and JEFF... all five years older. With KATIE is a man. This is HANK. In the interim, Katie has also taken a POLLY turns and her mother is there.

dialogues.speaker: POLLY
dialogues.text: Thank you, Mom. KATIE (crying)  Oh doll, you're so welcome. They embrace. After a moment POLLY draws away and looks a There is a brief moment of tension, and then POLLY embrac too.

dialogues.speaker: POLLY
dialogues.text: Thank you too, Hank. I'm sorry I was such a creep for so long... HANK (easily) You were never a creep, Pol. A girl only has one father.

dialogues.speaker: CONNIE
dialogues.text: Throw it! Throw it! After a moment, POLLY throws her bouquet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turning and turning through the air.

dialogues.speaker: INT. THE STUDY, WITH KATIE NIGHT
dialogues.text: The word-processor has been replaced by a wide lamp loomi stack of blueprints. The book-jackets have been replaced of buildings. Ones that have first been built in HANK's m presumably. KATIE is looking at the desk, thoughtful and a little sad HANK (voice) Coming to bed, Kate? She turns and THE CAMERA WIDENS OUT to give us HANK. He's a robe over pajamas. She comes to him and gives hima litt smiling. Maybe we notice a few streaks of gray in her hai pretty pony has done its fair share of running since BILL

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: In a little while. A woman doesn't see her first one get married every day, you know.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: I know. THE CAMERA FOLLOWS as they walk from the work area of the the more informal area. This is much the same as it was i days, with a coffee table, stereo, TV, couch, and BILL's chair. She looks at this.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: You still miss him, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Some days more than others. You didn't know, and Polly didn't remember. HANK (gently) Remember what, doll?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Polly got married on the five-year anniversary of Bill's death. HANK (hugs her) Come on to bed, why don't you?

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: In a little while.

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: Okay. Maybe I'll still be awake.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Got a few ideas, do you?

dialogues.speaker: HANK
dialogues.text: I might.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: That's nice. He kisses her, then leaves, closing the door behind him. sits in BILL's old chair. Close by, on the coffee table, remote control for the TV and an extension phone. KATIE l the blank TV, and THE CAMERA MOVES IN on her face. One te one eye, sparkling like a sapphire.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I do still miss you, big guy. Lots and lots. Every day. And you know what? It hurts. The tear falls. She picks up the TV remote and pushes the button.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ad for Ginsu knives comes to an end and is replaced by LOGO. ANNOUNCER (voice) Now back to Channel 63's Thursday night Star Time Movie... "Ghost Kiss." The logo DISSOLVES INTO a guy who looks like he died in a crash about two weeks ago and has since been subjected to hot weather. He comes staggering out of the same old cryp

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Terribly startled- almost horrified. She hits the OFF but the remote control. The TV blinks off. KATIE's face begins to work. She struggles against the i emotional storm, but the coincedence of the movie is just thing too many on what must have already been one of the emotionally trying days of her life. The dam breaks and s to sob... terrible heartbroken sobs. She reaches out for little table by the chair, meaning to put the remote cont it, and knocks the phone onto the floor. SOUND: The HUM OF AN OPEN LINE. Her tear-stained face grows suddenly still as she looks a telephone. Something begins to fill in... an idea? an int Hard to tell. And maybe it doesn't matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE CAMERA MOVES IN TO ECU... MOVES IN until the dots in the-hook receiver look like chasms. SOUND OF OPEN-LINE BUZZ UP TO LOUD. WE GO INTO THE BLACK... and hear BILL (voice) Who are you calling? Who do you want to call? Who would you call, if it wasn't too late?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There is now a strange hypnotized look on her face. She r down, scoops the telephone up, and punches in numbers, se at random. SOUNDS: RINGING PHONE. KATIE continues to look hypnotized. The look holds until is answered... and she hears herself on the other end of KATIE (voice; filter) Hello, Weiderman residence. KATIE- our present-day KATIE with the streaks of gray in goes on sobbing, yet an expression of desperate hope is t be born on her face. On some level she understands that t of her grief has allowed a kind of telephonic time-travel trying to talk, to force the words out. KATIE (sobbing) Take... please take... t-t-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's five years ago. BILL is standing beside her, looking concerned. JEFF is wandering off to look for a blank tape other room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Polly? What's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATIE (sobbing) Please-quick- SOUND: CLICK OF A BROKEN CONNECTION. KATIE (screaming) Take him to the hospital! If you want to live, take him to the hospital! He's going to have a heart attack! He-

dialogues.speaker: SOUND
dialogues.text: Slowly, very slowly, Katie hangs up the telephone. Then, moment, she picks it up again. She speaks aloud with no s consciousness whatever. Probably doesn't even know she's

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: I dialed the old number. I dialed-

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's just taken the phone from KATIE and is speaking to t operator. OPERATOR (filter, GIGGLES) I promise not to give it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATIE (finishes) -4408.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KATIE's trembling finger carefully picks out the number, hear the corresponding tones: 555-4408.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes her eyes as the PHONE BEGINS TO RING. Her face filled with an agonizing mixture of hope and fear. If onl have one more chance to pass the vital message on, it say one more chance.  KATIE (low) Please... please... RECORDED VOICE (filter) You have reached a non-working number. Please hang up and dial again. If you need assistance- KATIE hangs up again. Tears stream down her cheeks. THE C PANS AWAY AND DOWN to the telephone. INT. INT. She

dialogues.speaker: SOB
dialogues.text: her INT.

dialogues.speaker: BILL
dialogues.text: So it was a prank. Or someone who was crying so hard she dialed a wrong number... "through a shimmering film of tears," as we veteran hacks like to say.

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: It was not a prank and it was not a wrong number! It was someone in my family!

dialogues.speaker: KATIE
dialogues.text: Yes. Someone in my family. Someone very close. (Pause) Me. suddenly throws the phone across the room. Then she begin AGAIN and puts her hands over her face. THE CAMERA HOLDS for a moment, then DOLLIES ACROSS TO

dialogues.speaker: THE PHONE
dialogues.text: It lies on the carpet, looking both bland and somehow omi CAMERA MOVES IN TO ECU- the holes in the receiver once mo like huge dark chasms. We HOLD, then FADE TO BLACK.
